idiom: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
definition: Being far away from someone makes you love them more.

idiom: Don't rain on my parade.
definition: If I'm happy, don't try to make me sad.

idiom: Don't count your chickens before they hatch.
definition: Don't be too sure that something you hope for will really happen.

idiom: Let's hit the road!
definition: It's time to begin our journey!

idiom: Better safe than sorry.
definition: It's better to be extremely careful than to make a dangerous mistake.

idiom: The ball is in your court.
definition: It's your turn to make a decision.

idiom: Actions speak louder than words.
definition: What you do is more important than what you say.

idiom: You're barking up the wrong tree.
definition: You're looking in the wrong place.

idiom: The ball is in your court.
definition: It's your turn to make a decision.

idiom: It's time to go back to the drawing board.
definition: Our plan didn't work, so we have to start over.

idiom: It's the best thing since sliced bread.
definition: It's an amazing new invention.

idiom: Don't bite off more than you can chew.
definition: Don't agree to do more work than you can handle.

idiom: You can't judge a book by its cover.
definition: You can't tell what something is like based only on its appearance.

idiom: It costs an arm and a leg.
definition: It's extremely expensive.

idiom: There's no use crying over spilled milk.
definition: There's no reason to stay upset about something that happened in the past.

idiom: Curiosity killed the cat.
definition: Being too curious can get you into trouble.

idiom: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
definition: Don't invest all your resources in one thing.

idiom: I'm feeling under the weather.
definition: I'm sick today.

idiom: You hit the nail on the head.
definition: You got it exactly right.

idiom: It's time to hit the sack.
definition: I'm going to go to bed now.

idiom: Don't let the cat out of the bag.
definition: Don't tell the secret.

idiom: It happens once in a blue moon.
definition: It almost never happens.

idiom: It will be a piece of cake.
definition: It will be very easy.

idiom: Take it with a grain of salt.
definition: Don't take it too seriously.

idiom: We're all in the same boat.
definition: We are all having the same problem.

idiom: It's time to call it a night.
definition: I think we should stop and go home.

idiom: We're cutting it down to the wire.
definition: We're almost out of time.

idiom: It's time to hit the books.
definition: It's time to study.

idiom: It happened in the blink of an eye.
definition: It happened very quickly.

idiom: Don't lose your head.
definition: Don't get too emotional.

idiom: It happened out of the blue.
definition: It was completely unexpected.

idiom: I'm just pulling your leg.
definition: I'm just joking with you.

idiom: It's as easy as pie.
definition: It's really easy.

idiom: I feel like a fish out of water.
definition: I feel like I don't belong here.

idiom: Don't be a chicken.
definition: Don't be so afraid.

idiom: I'm broke.
definition: I don't have any money.

idiom: It's still up in the air.
definition: It hasn't been decided yet.

idiom: They were giving me the cold shoulder.
definition: They refused to talk to me because they were angry at me.

idiom: He's a happy camper.
definition: He's happy and content today.

idiom: Just sit tight.
definition: Just wait.

idiom: He's head over heels in love.
definition: He's very much in love.

idiom: It's time to get the ball rolling.
definition: It's time to start.

idiom: She was born with a silver spoon in her mouth.
definition: She was born into a rich family.

idiom: It won't break the bank.
definition: It's not very expensive.

idiom: I need to bring home the bacon.
definition: I need to make money to support my family.

idiom: Don't worry, I'll foot the bill.
definition: It's ok, I'll pay for it.

idiom: He went from rags to riches.
definition: He started out poor, but he became very wealthy.

idiom: She is a shoplifter.
definition: She frequently steals things from stores.

idiom: They're living from hand to mouth.
definition: They can't afford to save any money.

idiom: I can pick up the tab.
definition: I can pay the entire bill.

idiom: You're pouring money down the drain.
definition: You're wasting money.

idiom: May I put in my two cents?
definition: May I share my opinion?

idiom: Put your money where your mouth is.
definition: Stop talking about doing it and just do it.

idiom: I have butterflies in my stomach.
definition: I'm nervous but excited.

idiom: Cat got your tongue?
definition: Why can't you speak?

idiom: You should cut them some slack.
definition: You should not judge them too harshly.

idiom: It's like looking for a needle in a haystack.
definition: It's extremely difficult to find.

idiom: She's a tree-hugger.
definition: She believes strongly in saving the environment.

idiom: This is where I draw the line.
definition: I refuse to take this any further.

idiom: I need to get this off my chest.
definition: I need to tell someone this secret that's been bothering me.

idiom: Why don't you give it a whirl?
definition: You should try this new hobby.

idiom: It's going to go down in flames.
definition: It's going to be a total failure.

idiom: You need to go the extra mile.
definition: You need to put in extra effort.

idiom: We got here in the nick of time.
definition: We were almost too late.

idiom: It's as plain as day.
definition: It's very clear and obvious.

idiom: Don't put your foot in your mouth.
definition: Don't say something you'll regret later.

idiom: You should sleep on it.
definition: You should think about it for at least another day before making a decision.

idiom: You need to pull yourself together!
definition: You need to calm down and behave normally.

idiom: I feel as snug as a bug in a rug.
definition: I feel very cozy and warm.

idiom: You need to step up your game.
definition: You need to do something more impressive.

idiom: That's just the tip of the iceberg.
definition: That's only a small part of a much larger problem.

idiom: It looks like we're up a creek without a paddle.
definition: We're in an unlucky situation without a lot of options.

idiom: You rock!
definition: You're doing a great job!

idiom: It's not my cup of tea.
definition: I don't enjoy it.

idiom: We have bigger fish to fry.
definition: We have more important things to do.

idiom: He's a tough nut to crack.
definition: It's difficult to tell how he really feels.

idiom: I have a lot on my plate.
definition: I have a lot of work to do.

idiom: He's a couch potato.
definition: He sits on the couch all day.

idiom: It gives you food for thought.
definition: It gives you a lot to think about.

idiom: That's the story in a nutshell.
definition: That's a short version of the story.

idiom: They're like two peas in a pod.
definition: They're best friends.

idiom: Don't spill the beans.
definition: Don't tell the secret.

idiom: That one takes the cake.
definition: That's the most extreme instance.

idiom: I was over the moon!
definition: I was really happy.

idiom: He's like a bull in a china shop.
definition: He's very clumsy.

idiom: He's a copycat.
definition: He copies what other people do.

idiom: We're just killing time.
definition: We're not doing anything important, we're just waiting.

idiom: We're working around the clock.
definition: We're working 24 hours a day.

idiom: She's as cool as a cucumber.
definition: She's calm and relaxed.

idiom: Speak of the devil!
definition: We were talking about you just before you walked in.

idiom: I don't think we see eye to eye.
definition: I don't think we understand each other.

idiom: That will happen when pigs fly.
definition: That will never happen.

idiom: We can kill two birds with one stone.
definition: We can solve two problems at the same time.

idiom: Break a leg!
definition: Good luck with your performance!

idiom: We got the best of both worlds.
definition: We were able to enjoy two opposite opportunities at the same time.

idiom: He's green with envy.
definition: He's very jealous.

idiom: He has a green thumb.
definition: He's good at gardening.

idiom: She's the black sheep of the family.
definition: She doesn't fit in with the family.

idiom: He was caught red-handed.
definition: They found him doing something illegal.

idiom: I took a red eye flight.
definition: I took a flight in the middle of the night.

idiom: She was tickled pink.
definition: She was extremely pleased.

idiom: It's only a white lie.
definition: It's just a very small lie.
